headline: Over 4 Million Americans Roll Up Sleeves For Omicron-Targeted COVID Boosters
short_description: Health experts said it is too early to predict whether demand would match up with the 171 million doses of the new boosters the U.S. ordered for the fall.

headline: American Airlines Flyer Charged, Banned For Life After Punching Flight Attendant On Video
short_description: He was subdued by passengers and crew when he fled to the back of the aircraft after the confrontation, according to the U.S. attorney's office in Los Angeles.

headline: 23 Of The Funniest Tweets About Cats And Dogs This Week (Sept. 17-23)
short_description: "Until you have a dog you don't understand what could be eaten."

headline: The Funniest Tweets From Parents This Week (Sept. 17-23)
short_description: "Accidentally put grown-up toothpaste on my toddler’s toothbrush and he screamed like I was cleaning his teeth with a Carolina Reaper dipped in Tabasco sauce."

headline: Woman Who Called Cops On Black Bird-Watcher Loses Lawsuit Against Ex-Employer
short_description: Amy Cooper accused investment firm Franklin Templeton of unfairly firing her and branding her a racist after video of the Central Park encounter went viral.

headline: Cleaner Was Dead In Belk Bathroom For 4 Days Before Body Found: Police
short_description: The 63-year-old woman was seen working at the South Carolina store on Thursday. She was found dead Monday after her family reported her missing, authorities said.

headline: Reporter Gets Adorable Surprise From Her Boyfriend While Live On TV
short_description: "Who's that behind you?" an anchor for New York’s PIX11 asked journalist Michelle Ross as she finished up an interview.

headline: Puerto Ricans Desperate For Water After Hurricane Fiona’s Rampage
short_description: More than half a million people remained without water service three days after the storm lashed the U.S. territory.

headline: How A New Documentary Captures The Complexity Of Being A Child Of Immigrants
short_description: In "Mija," director Isabel Castro combined music documentaries with the style of "Euphoria" and "Clueless" to tell a more nuanced immigration story.

headline: Biden At UN To Call Russian War An Affront To Body's Charter
short_description: White House officials say the crux of the president's visit to the U.N. this year will be a full-throated condemnation of Russia and its brutal war.

headline: World Cup Captains Want To Wear Rainbow Armbands In Qatar
short_description: FIFA has come under pressure from several European soccer federations who want to support a human rights campaign against discrimination at the World Cup.

headline: Man Sets Himself On Fire In Apparent Protest Of Funeral For Japan's Abe
short_description: The incident underscores a growing wave of protests against the funeral for Shinzo Abe, who was one of the most divisive leaders in postwar Japanese politics.

headline: Fiona Threatens To Become Category 4 Storm Headed To Bermuda
short_description: Hurricane Fiona lashed the Turks and Caicos Islands and was forecast to squeeze past Bermuda later this week.

headline: Twitch Bans Gambling Sites After Streamer Scams Folks Out Of $200,000
short_description: One man's claims that he scammed people on the platform caused several popular streamers to consider a Twitch boycott.

headline: Virginia Thomas Agrees To Interview With Jan. 6 Panel
short_description: Conservative activist Virginia Thomas, the wife of Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas, has agreed to participate in a voluntary interview with the House panel investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection.
authors: Eric Tucker and Mary Clare Jalonick, AP

headline: Russian Cosmonaut Valery Polyakov Who Broke Record With 437-Day Stay In Space Dies At 80
short_description: Polyakov's record-breaking trip to outer space saw him orbit Earth 7,075 times and travel nearly 187 million miles.

headline: Reboot' Is A Clever And Not Too Navel-Gazey Look Inside TV Reboots

headline: Maury Wills, Base-Stealing Shortstop For Dodgers, Dies At 89
short_description: Maury Wills, who helped the Los Angeles Dodgers win three World Series titles with his base-stealing prowess, has died.

headline: 4 Russian-Controlled Ukrainian Regions Schedule Votes This Week To Join Russia
short_description: The concerted and quickening Kremlin-backed efforts to swallow up four regions could set the stage for Moscow to escalate the war.

headline: Fiona Barrels Toward Turks And Caicos Islands As Category 3 Hurricane
short_description: The Turks and Caicos Islands government imposed a curfew as the intensifying storm kept dropping copious rain over the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico.

headline: Golden Globes Returning To NBC In January After Year Off-Air
short_description: For the past 18 months, Hollywood has effectively boycotted the Globes after reports that the HFPA’s 87 members of non-American journalists included no Black members.

headline: One Dead After Plane Crashes At Reno Air Race

short_description: An annual celebration took on a different feel as Russia's invasion dragged into Day 206.

headline: Las Vegas Aces Win First WNBA Title, Chelsea Gray Named MVP

headline: James Cameron Says He 'Clashed' With Studio Before 'Avatar' Release

headline: Biden Says Queen's Death Left 'Giant Hole' For Royal Family
short_description: U.S. President Joe Biden, in London for the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II, says his heart went out to the royal family, adding the queen’s death left a “giant hole.”.

headline: Watchdog Report Finds Some Census Takers Who Fudged 2020 Data Didn’t Get Fired
short_description: Despite entering false information, their work wasn't redone fully and in some cases the census takers received bonuses, the Office of Inspector General reported.

headline: WHO Raises Alarm On Disease In Flood-hit Areas Of Pakistan
short_description: The World Health Organization is raising the alarm about a “second disaster” in the wake of the deadly floods in Pakistan this summer, as doctors and medical workers on the ground race to battle outbreaks of waterborne and other diseases.

headline: Privatization Isn’t The Answer To Jackson’s Water Crisis
short_description: Studies have repeatedly shown that ending public administration of water supplies doesn’t work — but that’s now on the table in Mississippi.

headline: German Customs Officials Follow Trail Of Slime And Find Bags Of Giant Snails
short_description: “Never in the history of the Duesseldorf customs office has a trail of slime led us to smuggled goods,” spokesman Michael Walk told the media.

headline: Amazon Greenlights 'Blade Runner 2099' Limited Series Produced By Ridley Scott
short_description: The director of the original 1982 film joins a writer of the 2017 sequel for the newest installment in the sci-fi franchise.
